# Part des marché des vaccins dans le monde {#intro}

Ce cas, typique de l'analyse des panels, compile pour tous les pays les données des effets de l'épidémie de COVID, ainsi que la couverture vaccinale. 

https://github.com/owid/covid-19-data/blob/master/public/data/vaccinations/vaccinations-by-manufacturer.csv


```{r pack, echo = TRUE, message=FALSE,warning=FALSE}

df <- read_csv("./Data/owid_Vaccin_ms_owid.csv")%>% spread(vaccine, total_vaccinations)%>%
  gather(variable,value,-location,-date)%>% replace(is.na(.), 0)
df %>%
  filter(location=="Uruguay")%>%
  ggplot(aes(x=date, y=value, group=variable))+
  geom_area(aes(fill=variable), alpha=0.5) 

df <- read_csv("./Data/Vaccin_ms_owid.csv")%>% spread(vaccine, total_vaccinations)%>%
  gather(variable,value,-location,-date)%>% replace(is.na(.), 0)

df %>% group_by(date, variable)%>%summarise(value=sum(value, na.rm = FALSE))%>%
  ggplot(aes(x=date, y=value, group=variable))+
  geom_area(aes(fill=variable), alpha=0.5)
table(df$location)
table(df$date)
table(df$variable)

```
